result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus R Thurston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
[ml] Cases 22CF153 and 22CF154 called at 2:36PM
Defendant Marcus R Thurston in court, in custody with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defense advises that it is prepared to proceed to Plea and Sentencing in file 22CF153. The Court proceeds with Plea and Sentencing:

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified. The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 5 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; THIS IS A TIME SERVED SENTENCE
--5 days credit for time already served given
--pay a $500.00 fine plus costs and DNA surcharge= $1,630.50, The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in the amount being converted to a civil judgment.
The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

-----------------------------------------------

The Court turns to the matter of extradition in file 22CF154:

Counsel provide arguments related to extradition.
The Court will promptly set and consider a hearing regarding further detention if it is requested by the Defense.

recess 2:51PM

[Post hearing, off the record: The Court schedules another date and time for appearance in file 22CF154 with counsel present: Status Conference on 06/10 at 8:30AM.]
[Post hearing, off the record: The Court directs the Clerk to withhold the entrance of the JOC, citing a procedural mistake the Court made when delivering the sentence.]

[MK] cases #22CF153, #22CF154 called at 1:41pm 
Defendant Marcus R Thurston in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Evidence is presented as to both the Preliminary Hearing (#22CF153) and the contested Extradition Hearing (#22CF154):   
Officer N. Zubke -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by DA Hall 
--State's Exhibit #1: packet with extradition supporting documents- offered; the Court notes it already has the document in the court file

In Case #22CF153:  The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Thurston committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.
In Case #22CF154: 
---The Court finds that the individual before the Court is the person wanted by the State of Florida, and that there is an outstanding Warrant in existence from that State for a felonious offense or an otherwise extraditable offense. 
---DA Hall asks that the time limit for extradition be extended an additional sixty days.
---After hearing arguments on the time-limit extension, the Court grants a thirty day extension.  
---The Court clarifies that the availability of the $10,000 Cash Bond remains in place. 
recess 2:10pm 

NEXT:  1) Pretrial Conference is to be held informally, (2) Arraignment in Case #22CF153 and Review Hearing in Case #22CF154 --both on May 10th at 2:30pm

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription

[ma] Cases 22CF153 & 22CF154 called at 1:43 PM 
Defendant Marcus R Thurston appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Initial Appearance occurs in Case 22CF153:
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit(scheduled for 4/19/22, with permission of both parties)

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

As to Case 22CF153, the Court requires a $1000  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription


As to Case 22CF154: Extradition is contested

The Court takes notice of Confirmation of Extradition, State of Florida DOC Warrant. 
The Court finds that this Mr. Thurston is the same as individual charged. 

The Court sets for extradition hearing in Branch 1

As to Case 22CF154, the Court requires a $10,000 CASH bond 

recess 2:00 pm. 

NEXT: Extradition Hearing on 4/19/22 at 1:30pm//Preliminary Hearing on 4/19/22 at 1:30pm
